intro: Waltheria indica var. americana, commonly known as the American blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and hairy, triangular leaves. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in wetlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
